description:
Barry and Steve imaged Melotte 15 from their remote observatory in Spain back in November 2018.  I decided that I would like to have a go at imaging it from our home observatory in the UK.  The scope and camera combination gave a significantly wider field of view, but at less resolution, of course.

Capture proved ‘interesting’.  We used filter focus offsets (as we usually do), but we forgot to calculate these offsets after rebuilding the rig following our trip to Spain – it was a new camera/scope combination for us.  As a result, we thought we had lost 12 hours of data.  As it turned out, once we calculated our offsets, the Ha and SII were thankfully pretty close to the Lum filter.  So we only (!) lost around 4 hours of OIII data – that is why we ended up with so much Ha. 
 
Melotte 15 lies within the heart of the Heart Nebula (IC 1805), around 7,500 light years away in the constellation of Cassiopeia.

Data for Melotte 15 were gathered between 18 November 2018 and 15 February 2019 from our home observatory in the UK. 

Capture details are as follows:

Telescope: Skywatcher Esprit 120ED 
Camera: Moravian G2-8300
Filters: Chroma 3nm NB 
Mount: Mesu 200

Ha: 32 x 1200s
OIII: 24 x 1200s
SII: 22 x 1200s

A total of 26 hours capture time.
title: Melotte 15 in Cassiopeia - SHO
